[],Right now, Jira collector only supports Tempo-Team plugin. Any plan about working for Jira without this plugin?

Dongsheng",207596834,1173,Is Jira collector going to fetch Team information without Tempo-Team plugin?,2017-02-14 18:25:59,2018-09-18 14:39:00,closed,12,tinabear,,"280655532 Correct. My team had discussed the idea of allowing arbitrary queries into the feature collection but we decided against it due to the complexity of having to support a query DSL. It would also require the collectors to have knowledge and be able to pull in arbitrary fields from the json response.
I do not have any plans to implement being able to support non-standard fields for teams. MarkRx
280715496 Thank you for answering my question. @MarkRx  tinabear
325091000 Hi,Is there an update on this? Is there anyway to use team concept in Jira without using tempo-teams plugin? shabna96
279810702 It does work without it. Use the latest codebase and remove the temp teams property MarkRx
279820802 Sorry, maybe i didn't express my question clearly.
I just want jira collector to show jira issues for different teams where tempo-team plugin is not installed. tinabear

279834388 @tinabear Do you have projects and teams configured in Jira without having the tempo-team plugin ? If you have a custom field defined for teams, you could set it for the property below and see if it works. Else set it to blank and the UI will assume team = Any.
# In Jira, your instance will have its own custom field created for ""team""
# This field allows you to specify that data field for your instance
# of Jira.  Note:  You can retrieve your instance's team ID field name via the following URI where your
# queried user story issue has team set on it; your custom field name describes the
# team value you expect to see:

279890114 @tinabear The code currently uses the TEMPO_TEAMS_REST_SUFFIX when you set feature.jiraTeamFieldName . Since you don't have tempo teams, hence the error when trying to invoke https://jira.xxxxxx.com/rest/tempo-teams/1/team . Can you find out the rest url for your team info and a sample json that is returned ? satishc1
280014868 The code does not support alternative mechanisms to representing teams outside of the tempo-team plugin at this time. The teamQuery setting does not appear to be used. MarkRx
280101219 @MarkRx So I cannot change anything to make the collector show team info outside of the tempo-team plugin, can I? Any further plan for this issue?

280655532 Correct. My team had discussed the idea of allowing arbitrary queries into the feature collection but we decided against it due to the complexity of having to support a query DSL. It would also require the collectors to have knowledge and be able to pull in arbitrary fields from the json response.
I do not have any plans to implement being able to support non-standard fields for teams. MarkRx

[],Using Hygieia as one tool across your enterprise for single view into your env, you can measure your progress for SDLC for your projects projects hosted on GIT. Metrics for Pulls and Issues can be added to the commits graph to show how the Pull Requests( code contributions) and Issues (ideas that help shape your project) are flowing in - and counts of developers committing, requesting a Pull and creating issues - would help us understand how popular your repo is.

Once the collector runs scanning GIT for all Pulls and Issues along with Commits as it does currently, it leaves the entries for the developers LOB/Department heads etc as TBD items so you can implement a local collector for your enterprise that scans for these and updates the fields by accessing your “HR” data sources.
Code changes required would include API, githubcollector and UI.

[],We found a bug in the gitlab collector that would stop you from being able to get commits if the collector ran for a repo, but the collector was misconfigured.  What would happen is the collector would have a bad configuration that didn't allow you to retrieve commits from git.  If someone then created a Gitlab repo in a dashboard, the collector would run, retrieve no commits, and set the last updated to the current time.  The ""first run"" would have been run already.  Then, when the configuration was fixed, the collector would have already done the first run, so it would only try to retrieve commits from the ""last update"" time, back 10 minutes.  Therefor never retrieving the commits from whatever value was specified for first run.  This change prevents updating the ""last update"" time on a repo unless there was a successful request made to gitlab.  Any HttpClientErrorException or ResourceAccessException will prevent the ""last update"" time from changing, which means, a newly configured repo will get it's first run again, and other repos will get all commits from the last successful run.

Sorry for the long explanation, I think there is probably more explanation than actual code.  Let me know if you have questions.",205195445,1149,Gitlab Bug Fix,2017-02-03 15:57:03,2018-09-18 14:38:58,closed,1,rob-miller-777,,"279826717 LGTM satishc1

[],Review https://github.com/capitalone/Hygieia/issues/1116 for initial thoughts regarding this PR.
* The create dashboard modal has been expanded to allow selection of widgets from all 3 panes (1 below).
* Update modal has been added to reselect which widgets the owner/admin wants to display (2 below).
* Configure icon has been added next to pane button set to allow for updates. This window can be expanded later to support extra dashboard specific configurations (3 below).
* Update is only available to owner/admin.
* Preexisting dashboards start with all widgets selected to support backwards compatibility, extraneous widgets can be removed by owner/admin.
* If no widgets are selected to be shown for a given pane, a helpful message appears explaining to any users wondering why no widgets are displayed.
* Template variable has been **removed** from the dashboard object, dashboard now maintains a map of available widget types and the panes where those widgets will be found.
* All template views have been consolidated into one single 'team.html/js' view.
**Note** This PR allows users to select which widgets are displayed, it does not allow for multiple widgets of the same type. IE, having 2 Repository widgets is not supported.

[],As we rollout Hygieia throughout our organization, we find ourselves having to update property files to account for Jenkins or Sonar servers to pull data from, and restart corresponding applications.

This enhancement enables maintaining this list of servers in a git repository (external from the application) and have Hygieia always pull the latest list of servers in every run without having to do any restart.

I do know there are other collectors that could take advantage of the collector-config-server. I first want to see if there's interest in this enhancement. If so, I could either apply it to the other collectors or have the community consume the collector-config-server as needed. I'm cool with either approach.",204387142,1138,Collector config server,2017-01-31 18:43:50,2018-09-18 14:38:57,closed,5,Mpluya,,"276494188 @Mpluya the build is failing because of Travis CI build log limitation. [],Jira and VersionOne refactoring in terms of making it uniform and also matching the overall design pattern of the rest of Hygieia.
1. Do not create any collector item from either VersionOne or Jira collector. Only create team and/or scope documents.
2. UI drop downs fetches data from scope (for Project drop down) and team (for team drop down)

3. Once UI config is saved, create a CollectorItem with the combination configured. The collector item will have the project and team selected on the UI. One of these has to be present, both can't be null (error validation on UI)

4. Jira collector and VersionOne collector collects feature data based on the project+team in the collector item collection. This can potentially save a lot of time in data collection too. (NOTE: This one is not included in this PR, it will be done in the future).
5. View options (such as Scrum or Kanban, Points or Count or Hours etc) are as usual saved in widget config options.
Steps to re-run the jira / versionone collectors once the PR is merged:
1. Make a backup of your database.
2. delete collector_items where collectorId in (select collectors.id from collectors where collectors.name in (""Jira"", ""VersionOne"") )
5. Build and install latest codebase for UI / core / api / collector.
6. Run UI, api, jira and versionone collector.
7. Clear your browser cache. Open your dashboard and re-configure your feature widget to pick the right project / team value.
Script for Steps 2, 3 and 4 is given below.

column3: print('Dropping collector_items where collectorId is ' + myDoc._id);

column1: print('Dropping collectors where collectorType in Feature, Scope, ScopeOwner');

Refer to api module readme updated by @Mpluya

Via docker, pass as an environment variable docker run -t -p 8080:8080 -v ./logs:/hygieia/logs -e ""SPRING_DATA_MONGODB_HOST=127.0.0.1"" -e ""JASYPT_ENCRYPTOR_SECRET=hygieiasecret"" -i hygieia-api:latest then pass the environment variable as a Spring boot system property java -Djasypt.encryptor.password=$JASYPT_ENCRYPTOR_SECRET -jar api.jar --spring.config.location=dashboard.properties

276392175 @benjaminwootton you could also just pass an environment variable called JASYPT_ENCRYPTOR_PASSWORD if you dont want to update your Dockerfile. The command would be : docker run -t -p 8080:8080 -v ./logs:/hygieia/logs -e ""SPRING_DATA_MONGODB_HOST=127.0.0.1"" -e ""JASYPT_ENCRYPTOR_PASSWORD=hygieiasecret"" -i hygieia-api:latest Mpluya

[],Resolves #1031. This was considerably bigger than @brennanananan and I had realized going in, but we feel like we have it at a really good spot. Test it out and let us know if there are any changes you would like to see or issues we need to address.  We are anticipating plenty of questions due to the nature of the pull request and it's size.
- Implemented JWT to provide stateless authentication/authorization
- Updated angular client to work with JWT tokens
- Implemented redirect functionality to take you to the page you were viewing if you token expires and the API returns a 401 status code
- Made secret key configurable to support having multiple instances of the API running
- Added Spring Security to Rest API
- Built in support for multiple forms of authentication (standard and ldap auth currently implemented)
- Refactored current login to work with Spring Security

- Created a UserInfo Repository separate from the Authentication repository to support multiple forms of authentication. This lets us control all application specific details of a user such as roles and themes independent of the authentication type. (Themes are still only handled by the angular app on the client, and saved in local storage, but this is something we can now save for a user if we want to)

- Made admin a ""role"" instead of just assigning admin privileges to the user named ""admin"". (Haven't implemented a way to assign new admins yet, so right now it works as before where the user named ""admin"" is given the role of admin, this is handled on the backend.  There is no way to give an ldap user ""admin"" privileges currently unless their name is actually ""admin"")
- Added method level security to dashboard modification controller so only owners of the dashboard or admins can modify a dashboard
- Added support for having multiple owners of a dashboard (have not created anyway to assign multiple owners yet, but shouldn't be hard to do)

- Implemented new owner functionality in such a way that it won't break backwards compatibility",203696480,1129,Spring Security/JWT Implementation,2017-01-27 17:42:15,2018-09-18 14:38:56,closed,41,rob-miller-777,,"299491245 @rob-miller-777 ,Thanks for your response.Still am getting same exception.

You are welcome! Here it is..
1. Build the Hygieia API project as a WAR artifact instead of JAR. i.e, Change the packaging to war in API project pom.xml, like below:
2. Deploy the api*.war file in Tomcat.
3. Hygieia API requires the ""dashboard.properties"" file for MongoDB connectivity. To set this up with in Tomcat container, do the following:
- Add a CATALINA_OPTS variable in Catalina.bat (or. sh under Linux) file like below (update the path based on your environment):
Note : I added the above variable right below this line:
Restart your Tomcat server. You should be able to run the UI that should connect to your API deployed within Tomcat successfully. Try it out!

289028759 @anuragmishracrest  - both are same, it is just how you name the properties file.  nireeshT
275528051 @amayesthing You can use apache httpd instead of tomcat and refer to   https://github.com/capitalone/Hygieia/issues/895 satishc1

I had looked into that because the issue that I cited above referring to the UI log files #1019 also requested details on the connection in the httpd conf.  I appreciate your suggestion and will take it back to the team to see if that would meet everyone's needs.  I would like to keep this open until I get concurrence from the team just in case anyone has a clever way to get it working under Tomcat.  Thanks again. amayesthing

I got this working by deploying the Hygieia API within the Tomcat container. Basically, the UI and the API are deployed within Tomcat and all the collectors are running as a stand-alone java processes. It works good and also provides an opportunity to scale-up & load balance APIs, if needed.
Let me know if you are interested in this deployment, I can document the changes (2 changes) and will send it out to you. spyndi

We have Rally which is SSO integrated and this is identity provider initiated. In which case Rally URL would not work due to IDP redirection. How does one generate security token in such scenarios to be used with REST APIs inside collector?

Booma Baskaran.",203066497,1121,SSO integration for collectors,2017-01-25 10:36:35,2019-01-29 16:16:59,open,6,BoomaBaskaran,,"458147599 I have the same issue, can you please let me know, if there is any update. Naveenraaj
458178128 If I'm understanding the question here, you have SSO login in front of your tools (e.g. Jira) and you want the collector to get past this. The answer will depend on the specific tool.

For example, in the case of the Jira collector, you can generate a token and use that in place of a password. In the case of SonarQube collector, a generated token stands in for the username and no password is required.
Your best bet is to refer to the docs for your product. spyoungtech

458391720 Sorry, I'm not familiar with rally. I would suggest referring to the product documentation.

Currently Hygieia allows the user to select a ""template"" from a hard coded list (capone, caponechatops, splitview, etc). The purpose from what I can tell (please correct me in the comments if I am wrong) is merely to change which widgets are displayed on initial dashboard creation. At this point there does not exist a way to easily create, modify, or delete these templates.
My proposal is to remove the notion of these templates, and allow the users to select which widgets they would like to be displayed during the dashboard creation configuration window.

The screenshot is a POC for the widgets on the ""Widget"" tab only. The change can easily be propagated to the ""Pipeline"" and ""Cloud"" tabs as well. In the case the all widgets are excluded, the tab will not show. For example, on the screen shot above, if all widgets are deselected, the ""Widget"" tab on the actual dashboard will be removed.

On a similar note, if a user decides that they would like all of the widgets shown in the example, the dashboard becomes too large to fit in one screen. Having a page that requires scrolling for an application like this may become cumbersome for users.
Two solutions have been suggested for this:
* Limit the amount of widgets in a dashboard.
* If the page requires scrolling, have the page slowly move up and down automatically to show all widgets.
Both approaches have merit, please let me know if there is feedback.

This change would allow teams to show precisely the information they desire, and would result in a cleaner looking dashboard instance in the case that a team does not want to utilize all widgets included in a pre-baked template.

Looking forward, this change incorporates adding widgets directly to the dashboard object itself. This can be utilized in the future to allow addition/deletion of widgets to pre-exiting dashboards.",202568680,1116,Proposal to remove templates from UI,2017-01-23 15:40:58,2018-09-18 14:38:55,closed,2,brennanananan,,"277077750 See https://github.com/capitalone/Hygieia/pull/1143 for PR brennanananan

274205649 Works with freestyle as well as pipeline. For freestyle, configure Hygiea publisher as post build action and select to publish deploy data. You will need an App Name to publish under (this is the one you will select in Hygieia deploy widget config drop down), an env name (whatever you want such as Dev, QA, Prod etc), a namespace, select which artifacts are being deployed (files under your workspace, supports wildcard) and optionally version number. Supply version number if the filename does not contain version number.  tabladrum

[],I was getting a 401 unauthorized error with the Bitbucket collector. After doing more research, it appears the issue is due to a special character (#) in the password used.

I placed an additional log.debug statement in the DefaultBitbucketServerClient, right after the password decryption: decryptedPassword = Encryption.decryptString(repo.getPassword(), settings.getKey());
As you can see, the '#' is missing.

,200784643,1091,Bitbucket password encryption/decryption with special character (#),2017-01-14 06:14:53,2018-09-18 14:38:53,closed,2,rdsteele,,273837206 I bet the UI isn't base64 encoding the password when sent in. Special characters may thus be interpretted as http parameters. MarkRx
324108327 I believe this issue is closed with PR #1651

273865733 So, my understanding is the password encryption error in the UI SCM widget configuration was solved by generating the secret key and adding that to the API properties file as 'key=secretkeyvalue'. This should allow the API to encrypt the password and store the credentials in the database. I also restarted my machine; stopping and starting the API process didn't seem to work for some reason, not sure why.
2. Property added to api.properties (or whatever your file is named)

Adding the secret key to the Bitbucket properties allows the collector to read the encrypted password from the database, decrypt it and call Bitbucket. If this fails, you'll probably be getting a 401 Unathorized error, which is how I discovered the issue with the '#' special character.
3. Property added to Bitbucket git.properties  (or whatever your file is named)

[],This harvests the enhancements in PR https://github.com/capitalone/Hygieia/pull/1049 and switches the config UI on both Jenkins and Sonar (widgets that deal with a massive data set) from ui-select to  an input with uib-typeahead, returning 20 results at a time. In order to use uib-typeahead, upgrading to the latest stable release of Angular (1.5.9) and latest version of UI-Bootstrap (2.3.0) were necessary.",198800834,1068,Client pagination,2017-01-04 20:17:29,2018-09-18 14:38:51,closed,16,Mpluya,,"278138459 @rob-miller-777 Looking at the screenshot for Option 2, I think Option 1 is definitely easier to use. Let me pull the PR down and play around with it a little more. At the moment i'm tending towards merging the PR as is. Let me discuss it internally here and i'll let u know soon. Thanks again for your team's effort on this. We truly appreciate the collaboration. satishc1

278138954 Sounds good, appreciate the feedback.  If you want to play around with option 2, let me know and I can get a branch out there.  Still needs some clean up, but functions properly.  rob-miller-777
280890454 @Mpluya Need to add the $scope in the deploy/config.js in the inject and the function.
@tabladrum @amitmawkin any feedback on client pagination? mdavis40

276754643 @Mpluya Thanks for the contribution. Can you please add a screenshot and some details on how the UI looks with this change? If you search for something in the ui select dropdown, and if it returns the first 20 hits, is there a next (prev) button for the user to select and look through the results ? satishc1
276963572 @satishc1 below is a screenshot of how configuring jenkins or sonar looks like with this enhancement.
The way we (@rob-miller-777 and I) have it configured is:
- on click to the search field without typing anything, it will send a server side request without any search criteria but the size of 20
- with the screenshot I provided below I typed in 'BusinessLine' as a search criteria. As I was typing this, the following server side requests were made:

This is so, because we've configured the search text field with a 250 ms of typeahead-wait-ms. Typeahead-wait-ms (from angular docs) is the minimal wait time after last character typed before typeahead kicks-in.
The idea is for users to type in what they are searching for and if the result they are looking for doesn't show up on the first 20 results, continue to refine the results by typing more.
Let me know if you need further details. Thanks.

277287732 @Mpluya @rob-miller-777 @mdskd @tabladrum Thanks for the screenshot and the details. If the results are being paginated, there should be a prev and next button to browse the ""pages"". The user will not know why their ""desired"" result is not showing up in the first 20 or whatever number we set. While this is a great feature we really need it, can you explore the possibility of adding a way to browse through the search results ? Your thoughts ? satishc1

277299120 Yeah, I think it could benefit from some sort of infinite scroll.  I think we had looked into that, but finding a library that could handle the filtering and infinite scroll was challenging.  We could take a look again however.   rob-miller-777
277325841 agree with comments that some sort of paging in the ui would be good - infinite scroll fits more in this particular scenario from a ui design perspective.
Let take a look at this next week @rob-miller-777 mdavis40

278082914 @satishc1 @tabladrum We have been trying a few different things to utilize pagination.  Our first attempt was to add infinite scroll to the UIB-Typeahead directive.  This doesn't seem to be possible without either modifying the source code for the typeahead directive, or creating our own.  Neither of which seem ideal to us.  We also couldn't find any existing libraries that combine infinite scroll/pagination and filtering in a select dialog.  We are currently trying a different approach by adding a table/list of ""jobs"" to the form, and server side pagination and filtering on top of that.  The functionality is much easier to implement for this, however the user experience suffers a little bit as it takes up more of the screen, and there are more buttons to click for navigating.  So the two options we are looking at right now are keeping the functionality as is in this merge request, where to find your job, you have to continue to type your job name until it appears in the list.  Or we can add the table with filtering and pagination.  We will submit a merge request with the second option when ready. rob-miller-777

278103097 @rob-miller-777 @tabladrum  If the UIB-typeahead paginated scrolling is tough to implement, then given a choice between the 2 options, I would pick option 1. We can have a quick conference call if you have some time available. We are on gitter.im, if you wanna ping me at a convenient time. Thanks for researching this. satishc1

Here is what option 2 could look like.  Could make some small tweaks, but something along these lines.  I don't think I'll be able to use gitter.im right now since it hasn't been approved here for business use.  So for the time being, would you mind just communicating here?
278136610 Just to be clear on the two options.
1. Functions as is in this current merge request.  No pagination.  Have to type in the name of your job until it appears.
2. List of jobs which can be filtered and paginated through an input box and pagination directive.

278138459 @rob-miller-777 Looking at the screenshot for Option 2, I think Option 1 is definitely easier to use. Let me pull the PR down and play around with it a little more. At the moment i'm tending towards merging the PR as is. Let me discuss it internally here and i'll let u know soon. Thanks again for your team's effort on this. We truly appreciate the collaboration. satishc1

278138954 Sounds good, appreciate the feedback.  If you want to play around with option 2, let me know and I can get a branch out there.  Still needs some clean up, but functions properly.  rob-miller-777
280890454 @Mpluya Need to add the $scope in the deploy/config.js in the inject and the function.

[],We ran into a scenario where one of our users created a dashboard with a slash ('/') in the name, i.e. ""Test/Dashboard"". While dashboard creation was successful, he then was unable to configure any of the widgets. This is so because the configure action was unable to hit the '/dashboard/myowner/{dashboardtitle}' endpoint, since his request was '/dashboard/myowner/Test/Dashboard'. My question to the group is, would there be interest in adding a validation around the dashboard name to prevent slashes and or any special characters? If yes, I'll open a PR on this. Thanks.",198721792,1067,Question: Dashboard name validation,2017-01-04 14:37:38,2018-09-18 14:38:51,closed,3,Mpluya," LabelName= bug
